name: Thai Chicken Satay with Peanut Sauce
description: Recipe video above. Thai Chicken Satay Skewers are tasty enough to eat plain but we'd never skip Thai Peanut Sauce for dipping! The essential ingredient for a really great peanut sauce is natural peanut butter with no added sugar or oil. But normal peanut butter will work fine too.
recipeIngredient: 400 g/14oz   coconut milk ((1 can), full fat)
600 g / 1.2lb   chicken thighs (, boneless skinless, cut into 2cm/4/5" pieces (Note 2))
Coriander / cilantro leaves and sliced red chilli ((optional))

recipeInstructions.text: If cooking on a BBQ or over charcoal, soak skewers for 2 hours in water.
recipeInstructions.name: If cooking on a BBQ or over charcoal, soak skewers for 2 hours in water.

itemListElement.text: Mix together the chicken and Marinade with 1/4 cup of coconut milk, then set aside for at least 20 minutes, or overnight.
itemListElement.name: Mix together the chicken and Marinade with 1/4 cup of coconut milk, then set aside for at least 20 minutes, or overnight.

itemListElement.text: Thread onto skewers - I do 4 to 5 pieces each.
itemListElement.name: Thread onto skewers - I do 4 to 5 pieces each.

itemListElement.text: Heat 1.5 tbsp oil in a large non stick pan over medium high heat.
itemListElement.name: Heat 1.5 tbsp oil in a large non stick pan over medium high heat.

itemListElement.text: Cook skewers in batches for 3 minutes on each side until golden.
itemListElement.name: Cook skewers in batches for 3 minutes on each side until golden.

itemListElement.text: Place remaining coconut milk and Peanut Sauce ingredients in a saucepan over medium low heat.
itemListElement.name: Place remaining coconut milk and Peanut Sauce ingredients in a saucepan over medium low heat.

itemListElement.text: Stir to combine then simmer, stirring every now and then, for 5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Stir to combine then simmer, stirring every now and then, for 5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Adjust consistency with water - it should be a pourable but thickish sauce.
itemListElement.name: Adjust consistency with water - it should be a pourable but thickish sauce.

itemListElement.text: Cover with lid and keep warm while cooking skewers.
itemListElement.name: Cover with lid and keep warm while cooking skewers.

itemListElement.text: Pour some sauce into a bowl. Sprinkle with some peanuts - stir some through if you want.
itemListElement.name: Pour some sauce into a bowl. Sprinkle with some peanuts - stir some through if you want.

itemListElement.text: Pile satay skewers onto a platter, sprinkle with remaining peanuts, coriander and chilli.
itemListElement.name: Pile satay skewers onto a platter, sprinkle with remaining peanuts, coriander and chilli.

itemListElement.text: Serve with sauce on the side for dipping. Add a side of Jasmine Rice or Thai Fried Rice to complete the meal!
itemListElement.name: Serve with sauce on the side for dipping. Add a side of Jasmine Rice or Thai Fried Rice to complete the meal!

review.reviewBody:
Finally I have found the Holy Grail of peanut sauce! I make it all the time. 

Couple of points though. I donâ€™t add water. Adding water made it a soup which I still devoured but none the less. I also added a bit more red curry paste to give it a bit more zing.

This sauce is one of the best recipes on the website (and it has huge competition!).  If you haven't tried it yet you're missing out big time!
I also don't bother with skewers.  I use Maesri paste, Ayam coconut milk and Mayvers smooth peanut butter.

The Mayvers peanut butter is also perfect for the muesli bars (crunchy version)

If you haven't made this recipe yet, what are you waiting for??? It is just.so.good! Everyone loves it!
* I can't be bothered putting meat on a skewer only to take it off again 15 mins later! So we cut the boneless chicken thighs into larger pieces/chunky strips, and cook on the cast iron grill pan.
* I use maesri paste, ayam coconut milk, and quality natural peanut butter.
* i always halve the sauce and still have lots leftover. Pop into mini ziplock bags in freezer to address sudden cravings. It defrosts perfectly.
* If halving the sauce i seem to end up with spare maesri paste,  the right amount for another batch of chicken. And so the cycle begins again...
So good!! I could easily drink the rest of the sauce , just wanna dunk everything into it. This is such an easy and so delicious recipe, amazzinnngg, must try !!
This chicken Satay recipe was excellent!  Everyone loved it!  Thank you!  I used chicken tenders and broiled for 5 min on each side.  They were perfect.
Truly excellent! And surprisingly quick and easy. So good. Thank you.

Long time fan of restaurant/take out Thai, newbie home Thai cook.  This was incredible, thank you! Husband loved the chicken, Iâ€™m vegetarian, loved the peanut sauce and marinade on veggies and tofu.  Made a pot of cilantro lime rice and it was a delicious meal that satisfied our itch for Thai take-out!

Hi. I cooked this yesterday from your cookbook, and thereâ€™s an error in the recipe. The body of the recipe says to use coconut milk, but the ingredient list shows 3/4 cup water and no coconut  milk. I think itâ€™s only supposed to be coconut milk with a little water if needed. I used both but my sauce was too liquidy.

So wanted to take credit for this fabulous recipe but my partner knows I use your website and cookbook!
Fab recipes, you are my go to

Amazing marinade and sauce ðŸ˜‹

Skewers were amazing , but marinating the thigh fillets  (whole) for 24 hours and cooking them the bbq/grill gives it an amazing char.  Just add the sauce, coriander, crushed peanuts, sliced Thai chilli and side of rice and boom!
This recipe is AMAZING! Next time I make this I would use less salt in the marinade and chicken breast instead of thighs
Made this for dinner tonight. Not my first recipe from Nagi, but first time cooking this one. Holy @#$%. This was amazing and I could happily have that peanut sauce ingested intravenously.

keywords: Chicken satay skewers, Thai chicken satay, Thai peanut sauce
